fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3081].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Able to configure the customer portal to show a detailed customer work queue with the ability to filter and search the queue on the basis of various criteria (e.g. Priority, SLA, Date Submitted, Last Response). We require queues similar to the ones that are available for agents, but we need them for our customers.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide customer queue at customer portal
fields.summary: As customer, would like to have customer work queue in Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3080].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , recipient and CC email information is not visible for admin . So , inserting the information to description is needed for issue creating via email

h3. Suggested Solution
Add recipient and CC information to issue description .
fields.summary: As admin, would like to add recipient and CC information to description for request via email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3079].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA Service Desk sends an automatic email message when a support request is created

There is an improvement request for customizing this:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-218

JIRA Service Desk has the option to completely disable notifications, but not to only disable these notifications for request creation and keep the ones for updates in requests.

These notification messages are different from the others, as they contain a text message not customizable by administrators, so the users must receive those, regardless of the administration choice. Notification on updates in the issue, on the other hand, only show the modifications.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to prevent SD from sending these automatic replies for creating requests, but keep the customer notified on request updates.
fields.summary: Option to disable auto-reply on issue creation in Service Desk
Improve SLA re-configuring
SLA time format: "days, hours, minutes"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3048].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The "Linked issue matches" automation condition cannot be added 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new automation rule of type _Update incident when linked problem transitions_
# Edit the preexisting _Linked issue matches_ rule or add a new one

h3. Expected Results
One should be able to select options to match
h3. Actual Results
The following message appears: _{color:red}This condition could not be loaded.{color}_
And the following appears in the browser's console:
{code}Error rendering form s {cid: "c476", attributes: Object, collection: s, _changing: false, _previousAttributes: Object…}_changing: false_events: Object_listenerId: "l477"_listeners: Object_pending: false_previousAttributes: Objectattributes: Objectchanged: Objectcid: "c476"collection: s__proto__: r TypeError: n is not a function(…){code}
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to add the "Linked issue matches" condition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2978].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When a customer raises a Service Desk request, and the assigned agent creates a Knowledge Base article based on it, the article does not show up on the Open Requests page of the Portal.
This leads to unnecessary interactions between customer and agent. 


h3. Suggested Solution
 
Develop a solution where if a request has a newly created knowledge base article related to it, this article should show up on the customer request page.

h3. Workaround 

Current leaving a comment for the customer with a link to the article works.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk agent, I want the KB article I have created for a customer request to show up for that customer in a separate field on the customer portal.
Internal only required field - possible to be Optional with default in portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2974].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 6.x, under the "Service Desk" menu, we have an option to _Create Service Desk Request_, where we can create a Service Desk on behalf of a customer. We simply need to click there, select a project and then create the issue.

Now in JIRA 7 we don't have that option anymore. We need to click on _Projects > Service Desk_, select one Project and then click on the _Customer Portal_ option in the left menu.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can have a direct option to create a Service Desk, like we had in JIRA 6. Can be with the Service Desk menu back to the top OR a dropdown in the "Create" option, where we can select _Service Desk_ or _JIRA_ (not sure, but I believe we had this before in JIRA 7).

JIRA Service Desk 3.0.2
JIRA Software 7.0.0

h3.Potential Work-around
You might be able to create a direct link to the customer portal using the [Application Naviagator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-346948276.html] as an alternative.  I understand this isn't exactly the same functionality, however it would at least provide a link to service desk customer portal in the menu bar.
fields.summary: Create Service Desk Request option for JIRA 7
To be able to copy Request Types for Project Created with shared configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2972].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Admin only have ability to select Basic Service Desk template or IT Service Desk template during creating a new project . But , they can't change it for existing project . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability for admin to change template for existing Service Desk template
fields.summary: As admin, have options to change from Basic Service Desk template to IT Service Desk

Hi,
We have a problem with the password reset.
We forget  our password but the mail address associate doesn't work anymore.
Our *UserID* is {color:red}i4c.support{color} and the old e_mail associate is *nicola.colla@i4c.it *.
 But we have change this e_mail with AAAP.support@accenture.com. Can we change the e_mail associate at our UserID (i4c.support)? After can we send the new password?

Best Regards

Permission Scheme adds "Application Role (Any logged in user)"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2967].
  {panel}

Compared to the Automation plugin that only works on JIRA 6, the Automation built into Service Desk is worthless.  Please add all functionality from the v6 plugin into Service Desk 2.4+.  People need the ability to do more things to Issues than change the status.

Example of an automation rule I need to be able to make:
Once a ticket is opened, every 4 hours the priority goes up a level (I created priorities labelled 1 through 9) as long as the ticket is Open/In Progress and it's during normal business hours.  A comment is added to the Issue for each escalation and if the Issue reaches priority 9 an email is sent to the assigned Tech and his Manager.

Normal workflows and automation don't allow any of this to happen that I can see.
fields.summary: Automation Updates
Improve the Service Desk notification documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2965].
  {panel}

*Summary:*

The migration hub does a great job on informing customers if they are migrating to JIRA 7, Service Desk, and Software. However in some cases we make a slight modification to improve the path for customers who already have JIRA 7 and simply want to add JIRA Service Desk or JIRA Software.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

When you navigate to the initial download link:

!jsinitial.png|thumbnail!
!jsdinitial.png|thumbnail!

Click All versions: 

!jsAllversions.png|thumbnail!
!jsdAllversions.png|thumbnail!

Notice that you only see the option to click "Already have JIRA software or JIRA core" if you click All versions. 


*Suggestion:*

It should have the same link persist on both screens "Already have JIRA software or JIRA core" and optionally the suggested method of [JIRA service desk Upgrade task list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/server_jira+jsd_upgrade] of step 4 (ease of use of installation instead of the obr method).
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Software or JIRA for Service Desk download/installation navigation
Improve the search function performance in 'My request'
Selectable number of shown issues in 'My requests'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2962].
  {panel}

Hey guys!

Instead of creating a ticket in the service desk portal, we often create tickets from the "Create" button (project button) in JIRA.

The problem when we do this is that the Service Desk Request Type shows up as "No Match" even though I have setup the request type in the service desk.

Example:
https://visualjazz.jira.com/projects/SJSD/queues/353/SJSD-14
 !image-2015-11-17-17-46-42-821.png|thumbnail! 

Is there any way to set this so that this happens automatically? 

Otherwise if we request participants before doing this, they do not receive the notification.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Dynamically setting "Service Desk Request Type" when creating an issue in Jira
Option to Display Time Tracking in Service Desk Customer Portal view for certain users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2960].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , new Customer user will only assign to Service Desk Customer role , which only have access to Customer Portal . As admin , would like to have an option to allow Customer user auto assign to JIRA Internal User group.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give option to allow Customer user auto assign to JIRA Internal User group for Service Desk configuration.
fields.summary: As admin, would like to have option to auto assign Customer user to JIRA Internal user group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2959].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As a JIRA Service Desk Administrator, I would like to be able to set up my Service Desk to auto assign tickets in a Round Robin fashion. This would be extremely helpful if it offered several different ways to have auto-assignment handled 

h3. Environment
Cloud
Server

h3. Steps to Enable
# Open project settings
# Click on a menu option in the left hand menu (perhaps Auto Assignment?)
# Select the type of auto assignment you want to enable within the Service Desk project

h3. Actual Results
Currently there is no option to do this within Service Desk
 
h3. Notes
This feature would add more value if it allowed at minimum these two types of round robin assignment:

- Assignment based on number of issues each Service Desk Agent currently has
- Assignment based on all Service Desk Agents that are part of the Service Desk queue (this would not take into consideration backlog per agent rather it would just simply go down the list and assign tickets)
fields.summary: Automatically round robin assign Service Desk requests
License

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2953].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Adding participant triggers email notification to the user who has been added. Removing and adding participant triggers unnecessary email notifications.

h3. Solution 
To classify this notification under one of the notification events at notification scheme so admin can enable/disable it according to their needs.
fields.summary: To Be Able To Disable Notification For Adding Participant

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2950].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA is possible to set the handler to search in a specific folder. This is not possible on Service Desk.

h3. Suggested Solution
Be able to set the email from a specific folder to be sent to a Service Desk queue. 

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Send email from specific folder to a Service Desk queue.
Inapppropriate translations in Jira Service Desk when a queue is empty

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2945].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Service Desk , only SLA based reporting can be created directly from Service Desk reporting feature . As an admin, would like to create customise report and auto populated graph. Below is few of example of reporting and graph :-
# Average time to resolve for entire service desk
# Number of tickets resolved by service desk / 2nd-3rd line / per team    per week
# Age of open calls
# Calls opened vs calls closed each day / week / month\
# Average rating per agent

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide customization reporting and auto populated graph from Service Desk reporting

h3. Workaround 
Use [JIRA Charting Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting] or [eazyBI JIRA reports and charts plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.eazybi.jira.plugins.eazybi-jira/server/overview]
fields.summary: As admin, would like to create customise report and graph

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2943].
  {panel}

JIRA Service Desk 2+ introduced a new way for restricting comments. This will not work in all Service Desk scenarios.

It would be great to choose per project if i want to use:
* Role / Group based comment security like in all other JIRA projects
* New Service Desk comment security (to customer / internal)

In booth cases i want to have the _add attachment_ feature (JSD-610).
fields.summary: Ability to decide the comment security per Service Desk project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2942].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The [Time Tracking Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/time-tracking-report-185729564.html] enables us to track time for issues. Currently this is not available for Service Desk Projects but is included in Software and Business Projects only.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include [Time Tracking Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/time-tracking-report-185729564.html] to JIRA Service Desk Projects.
fields.summary: Include Time Tracking Report in JSM projects
Project sidebar links fallback for non agents

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2940].

Hello,

I would like to know if upgrading from SD 2.3.6 to 2.5 will affect our enterprise license? 
As we have to upgrade Jira itself as well, it also would be interesting if this upgrade will affect our Jira license?

Thank you in advcance!

BR,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2939].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In current setting , customer only able to raised issue by email if they in customer list or automatically registered once creating issue by email . By default , all customer in the list will have access to customer portal . As a admin, would like to control customer access to customer portal and raise issue by email independently.

h3. Suggested Solution

Give configurable permissions for Customer Portal access and send request by email.
fields.summary: As a admin, would like control customer access to customer portal and raise issue by email independently

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2937].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Click the "Comment internally" button and the Reporter (even if not an Agent) receives the comment via email. This is unexpected behavior.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create ticket with someone that is not an agent
# Create internal comment
# Reporter gets email even though he/she is not an agent

h3. Expected Results
Comment should stay internal and not send to anyone that is not an agent

h3. Actual Results
No agent gets notification

h3.Workaround
No workaround known of
fields.summary: "Comment internally" emails to Reporter who is not an Agent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2934].
  {panel}

The custom field _request participants_ has the same functionality like Cc in emails.

In our service desk configuration we have some request types where the customer needs to enter their direct manager (e.g. extend file server permissions, get a license for a commercial software, ...).

Due to the restriction that only _agents_ can comment to the customer (reporter) a default JIRA user picker will not work in this scenario. Every other user than agents also request participants can only write internal comments if the comment is not written via the customer portal.

Also the manager will not see the requests of his team within his customer portal.

Additional add a permission type for this field so that it can be used in issue security levels or notification schemes.
fields.summary: Ability to create your own custom field from the same type as request participants

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2933].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
The inability to capture a users organization during the self-service user sign-up process for Jira Service Desk makes it hard to identify which organizations are generating support requests.

*Requested Behaviour*
Add a field for a user to specify their organization name as well as their name and email address when they sign up for a Service Desk customer account and is editable by administrators.
fields.summary: Ability to add a custom field such as Customer's Organization in Service Desk customer portal profile

fields.description:

Our JIRA Capture tool for our On Demand application keeps giving the following error ro all users on our team.

The message reads:------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It looks like Capture for JIRA has run into an unexpected fatal error. You will need to restart Capture for JIRA which may fix this issue.

If this problem persists, try the "Clear server settings" button below.

Report problem with Atlassian (remember to include the support information below).

Here is the Support Information I was told to provide:-----------------------------------------------

URL: https://football.atlassian.net/rest/bonfire/1.0/issue-attach?issueKey=FB-11937
Request method: POST
Status code: 504
Status message: OK
Error key: error.rest.defaultCapture for JIRA version (server): 2.9.7.0034Capture for JIRA version (browser): 2.9.6.0Capture for JIRA details: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/46.0.2490.80 Safari/537.36
Platform: Win32
-----Capture for JIRA Plugin Properties
version: 2.9.7.0034
buildDate: 2015-10-26T00:00:00.000-07:00
buildNumber: 
licenceStatus: activated
jiraVersion: 7.0.0-OD-08-005
jiraBuildInfo: 7.0.0-OD-08-005#70107-sha1:5fb2f7e0c016d05ff672e1e32fcd963de6cf92ae

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2737].
  {panel}

Hello team,

My SLA times are frozen even when it is within business hours I have pre-defined in the calendar. Please see attached for two screenshots. You can see my desktop time showing it is well within my SLA of "9-5 PM Business hours". This did not occur before, but only recently (possible past couple weeks). However, when I place "In progress" usually the clock will become unstuck. 

My System default is (GMT-05:00) New York, which is correct. 

Tickets affected:
- https://heatit.atlassian.net/browse/MHSD-299 (This one is still stuck)
- https://heatit.atlassian.net/browse/MHSD-169 (I moved into "In Progress" and now it works)

I have also attached my SLAs
fields.summary: Frozen SLA Time (Project = MHSD)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2736].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, only Agents can generate reports from within JIRA

h3. Suggestion
Have a reporting function in the Customer Portal so that the customers themselves can view these reports. For example: Time to Resolution report

This way, the customer is able to know the average Time to Resolution for the issues the customer created.

Other reports would be Opened Request/Close Requests so customers are able to see how many request they have opened in a month, etc
fields.summary: Reports in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2734].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When there's a problem with incoming mail due to certain error , incoming mail will stop . But , service desk email still flooded with email . Once , the problem solved , all emails created issue tickets . Eventhough , the email is from few days back , which issue creation no longer needed . If admin able to configure amount of time , whatever email created before the current time minus amount of time configured , issue ticket won't be created.
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Give admin an option to configure amount of time limit for issue creation from email .
fields.summary: As admin, would like to set time limitation on creating request by email
Assignment Issue due to permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hi,

There are many issue we resolve with single comment. If we want to attach any screenshot while resolving any issue, there is no way we can do that. Could you please improve this,


Thanks
Mahesh
fields.summary: Please add an attachment field while resolving an issue
Ability to expose SLA ticker to clients

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2641].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When installing/upgrading Service Desk, it might auto create several configurations such as Field Configuration, Field Config Scheme, etc. However, there will be times where the upgrade failed after some of these configurations are created. These created configurations could then cause confusion and even errors in the system.

h3. Suggestion
Handle these failed install/upgrade tasks better, perhaps by auto removing any created configurations.
fields.summary: Better handling of failed installation/upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2640].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 7, the _Help Center_ is no longer displaying separate Service Desk description. Instead, it's showing the recent _Request Type_ and the list of SD projects on the left side.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have an option to show each of the Service Desk description on Help Center.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to show the separate SD description in Help Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2639].
  {panel}

Dear Support 

I recently tried to install the following 3rd party add-on
"Gannt Cloud" by WISOFT:
https://wisoft.atlassian.net/wiki/display/GanttOnDemand/Working+with+Gantt+charts
 
Our Jira could instance is: https://praekelt.atlassian.net


Steps to replicate:
--------------------------
I went to our JIRA Cloud instance and went to the Atlassian Market place page (/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/search?q=gantt)
I then clicked on the free trial button for Gantt Cloud and a pop up appeared.
I clicked the "Accept & Install" button.
The installation seemed to run but then I got the following error on the screen:
"Could not install add-on "Gantt Cloud" because it requires administrator privileges and atlassian-addons-admin group does not have the JIRA administrator global permission."
 
I then tried to remedy this by going to the Global Permissions in our JIRA cloud system and adding the Atlassian-add-on-admin to the "Browse Users" group  here:
/secure/admin/GlobalPermissions!default.jspa
>> This did not seem to help as I still get this same error when trying to install the "Gantt Cloud" 3rd party plugin.
 
There seem to be these 2 tickets I found on the matter:
AC-1014
AC-1238
Are these above still an issue?
 
Please can you assist me in trying to install this plugin and let me know if there is something that I need to do.

>> Please see the Answers response I got from the Atlassian client support (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/32022670/answers/32022850)
 
Thanks
Sean
fields.summary: Gannt Cloud Add on by WISOFT installation error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2638].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer is not allowed to edit notification email settings at their profile in Customer Portal . Only JIRA Service Desk admin are allow to change it from JIRA . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer should allow to edit their own email notifications settings from the customer portal.
fields.summary: As a customer, should allow to edit notification email settings from customer portal
Combine reports from multiple SD projects into one report
Cannot edit Service Desk preferences
Cannot add internal comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2520].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When setting up an automation rule using {{request-channel-type = portal/email}} as a condition, it does not work.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a _Custom Rule_ automation
# _WHEN_: Issue Created
# _IF_: Issue matches -> Advanced -> {{request-channel-type = email/portal}}
# _THEN_: Add comment (key in any text as a comment), _Comment Type_: Internal/Public
# Create a new issue either from _Customer Portal_ or by sending an email

h3. Expected Result
Comment is added on the newly created issue

h3. Actual Result
No comment is added
fields.summary: Automation rule using request-channel-type as a condition does not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2519].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently to set up email creation using an email account, an admin must use the POP3 or IMAP settings of an Exchange server, and not Exchange itself

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide support for Exchange email
 
h3. Workaround 
Continue to use IMAP or POP3 Exchange server settings
fields.summary: As an administrator, provide the ability to set up issue creation from email using an Exchange account

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2518].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
A ticket can go through multiple cycles of the same SLA. The SLA web panel will then show whether this ticket met or breaches the SLA for each individual cycle
!1.png! 

However, there isn't any reporting capabilities for this information. The default SLA report will only show whether the *latest* is met or breached.

h3. Suggestion
Create a report for this information where users can see exactly how many *cycles* of SLA are met or breached based on a JQL query
fields.summary: Additional reporting for same ticket with multiple SLA cycles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for {*}JIRA Service Desk Cloud{*}. Using {*}JIRA Service Desk Server{*}? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2517].
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Update 20th December, 2021*

Hi everyone,
Thanks for your patience. As stated earlier, this is in the top few items we want to solve for email.

We have shipped https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2373 and are currently developing a solution for https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5878 . This issue is the next item on our roadmap.

Cheers,
Jason and the Jira Service Management Team
{panel}
*Current Behaviour*
All the information can be found in the Service Desk mail log. Service Desk Mail log requires user to constantly monitor the log to see if a ticket has failed or not. It would be great to receive a notification like how JIRA does.
 * JIRA Email handling error:
!image.png!
fields.summary: Notifications for incoming emails that fail to be processed
JQL of workload Report doesn't brings results if users have email on "username"
Ability to customize the search field default text in Customer Portal base

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2513].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In JSD  notifications are either on or of. According to the documentation, if email is switched of in service desk then a notification scheme in JIRA can be used to set up a custom scheme. This still does not work well for us because we need notifications for some transition (e.g. a request is waiting for customer input) and some do not (e.g. it is placed on the backlog or an engineer has started work). It would be so much more elegant if an admin could check for each transition in the Service Desk if a notification should be sent or not. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a customer notification scheme configuration. Admin can control the notification event and which customer should receive the notification.

h3. Why this is important
Provide flexibility to admin configuring customer notification.
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Customize notification scheme in Service Desk settings
Allow service desk customers to have more relaxed password policy than other Jira users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2511].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently to create a Service Desk, you must do it one at a time.

h3. Suggested Solution
For admins that need multiple Service Desks with the same settings, it would be nice to either:
# Duplicate existing Service Desks
# Create multiple Service Desks at one time using same settings, i.e. Bulk Create Service Desks
fields.summary: As an admin, allow duplication or bulk creation of Service Desks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2510].
  {panel}

At the moment the system only suggest articles if the customer is searching for something or if he is opening an issue. I think it would be very nice if the customer could click through all articles and read them. 

So it would be nice if service desk show some categories under the request items on the customer portal. 

I saw this at a support portal here: http://supportuk.sumup.com (see screenshot)

There are all catogories and the top 5 articles of the category. 

Another nice feature is a comment function on articles. The articles would be more integrated than just open a popup.
fields.summary: Make KB articles more integrated into Service Desk
Add categorization to automation rules

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2508].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, if you are an SD Agent, you can click on the project and see the *Customer Portal* link in the side bar. If you are part of the SD Team, you can also do the same to access the Customer Portal.

However, if you are just a Service Desk Customer (but have access to either Core or Software), there is no links which will allow you to access the Customer Portal when you are logged in to JIRA. You will have to remember the URL of the Portal and manually type it in to access it

h3. Suggestion
Have a page to list the portals which this user is allowed to access only as a customer.
fields.summary: Customer Portal links in JIRA for SD Customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2507].
  {panel}

I'm attaching 2 screenshots. One is showing the current functionality found in JIRA Software Issue Navigator, where by clicking in a column title, the content is sorted out by that column. If the column is clicked again, the sorting order is reverted in the same column. I propose a similar functionality in JIRA SD.

Problem Definition
Not able to sort columns by clicking on it on JIRA Service Desk

Suggested Solution
Do as on JIRA Issue navigator where you can click on columns and sort the issues by the column, click again and reverse the order.
 
Workaround 
The only available workaround is to choose the columns you want to be the key to sort the list of issues on Service Service, although you have to edit it, not only click like on JIRA Navigator
fields.summary: Sort list of issues by clicking on the column on Service Desk
Allow Pre-populated Commenting to be Configured Instance Wide

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2503].
  {panel}

Installing JIRA Service Desk Add-on on JIRA 6.4.12 changes the behavior of the [Checklist Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.okapya.jira.checklist].

Service Desk seems to enable "Save on blur" for the Checklist Customfield. This custom field cannot work with the normal Blur Trigger as items such as menus are created outside of the DOM for the Checklist Field.

Projects not under Service Desk are not affected by this.

This is extremely problematic as it causes important lost of functionality for the Checklist Add-on.

*Steps to reproduce*

* Install  [Checklist Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.okapya.jira.checklist]
* Create Checklist Customfield, add options and add it to a Service Desk project screen
* From Service Desk, select an issue
* Enter inline editing for the Checklist directly in the Issue Details View
* Modify the Checklist by adding items
* Select top right gear menu on the Checklist Header
* Select "Check all items"
* Checklist will start a "save on blur" and will not properly commit the changes. (Checklist did not enable "Save on blur" since it has elements such as menu which resides outside the customfield DOM. However Service Desk seemed to have enabled the behavior).
* Redo from step 3 but click on the issue Edit button.
* Close Edit dialog
* Checklist has now lost its "save of blur" trigger.
fields.summary: Service Desk Add-on changes behavior of Checklist add-on

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2501].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Service Desk does not allow certain ticket priorities to be hidden from specific customers. All ticket priorities are available to all customers within JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA Service Desk Administrators to specify which customers can see specific priorities. The use case here is that certain customers pay for different levels of service and thus the providing company wants to be able to tier their priorities based on this.
fields.summary: Allow certain priorities to be hidden based on customer in Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2500].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Users are able to sort issue (Ascending / descending) by just clicking the column name on _Issue Navigator_. It would be great to have this feature available in Service Desk Queue. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to sort the issues on Service Desk Queue by clicking the column name.
fields.summary: Ability to sort issues by clicking the column name
No notification sent when a comment is changed from Internal to Shared with customer
Ability to remove by default the signature when the Agent respond to the Customer
Add "My Requests" to the JIRA drop downs for Service Desk
Add the ability to import holidays with an calendar file (.ics)

Daily Sales report

Adele Gleacher

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2493].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Issue Creation and add Participant Notification will contain the Description of the request in the Email Subject. But for Issue Updated Notification, the Description is not included in the Email Subject. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Description of the request should be reflected in the subject line of all Notification
fields.summary: Description of the request should be reflected in the subject line of all Notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2492].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+

As a JIRA Service Desk administrator, I'd like to allow customers to log in through the JIRA login page. Currently, if I have JIRA hosted at *jira.example.com*, I'll need to direct customers to *jira.example.com/servicedesk/customer/user/login?destination=portals* so they can log in. 

h4. +Suggestion+

Allow customers to log in from the login gadget or main login page, and automatically redirect them to the *Customer Portal*.
fields.summary: Allow Customers to Log in through JIRA regular Login pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2491].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition 

Having Connectivity and Processing Logs only to be observed at UI makes it difficult for support team to check them.
Also it is strange for customer to provide screenshot of logs along with attaching support.zip

h3. Suggested Solution 
Per JSD-2412, Service Desk needs to create incoming mail log file even if there is no mail handler in JIRA core along with Connectivity and Processing logs.
fields.summary: Create And Include Connectivity and Processing Logs In Support.zip
Refreshing screen automatically opens new comment (IE only)
Screenshot paste function disappeared
Option to remove the Search Bar in the Service Desk portals overview.
Allow Releases/Version panel to be displayed in SD project type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2442].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When uploading a specific logo, with a specific colour, JIRA Service Desk modifies the colour somewhat in the conversion to a BASE64 Image. 

See the attached sample image.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option for an 'as-is' image, so that no modification to the image is made when uploading it.

h3. Workaround
None recorded.
fields.summary: Provide an 'AS IS' logo option for Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2437].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Comment Required Validator no longer reporting error when comment is not added upon resolving issue

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0.0-OD-08-002 with JIRA Service Desk 3.1.0-OD-01-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA MISC Workflow Extension
# Configured *Comment Required Validator* at Service Desk project workflow for one of the transition.
# Test the transition without comment . Customised error doesn't pop up.

h3. Expected Results
Test the transition without comment . Customised error will pop up.
h3. Actual Results
Test the transition without comment . Customised error doesn't pop up and atlassian-jira.log return below error :-
{noformat}

Ability to create Customers on the Issue Create Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2434].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA user with a space in the username. (e.g test test)
# Create a Service Desk ticket in the Customer portal
# Click on Add people in the portal and add the JIRA user that you've just created. (test test)

h3. Expected Behaviour:
JIRA user is added as a participant

h3. Actual Behaviour:
Throws Error "*User cannot be found*".
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround:
Edit and remove the space in the username.
fields.summary: JIRA User can't be added as a participant in Service Desk customer portal if there's space in the username
Nfeed or similar for Jira On Demand
JSD mail handler fails to process if incoming mail has an empty subject line

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2428].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The *Request Participant* Field When added to the create issue Screen does not populate on the screen

h3. Environment
* (Cloud) JIRA Service Desk v3.0.0-OD-04-002-D20150924T014602
* (Cloud) JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.663.0
* JIRA v1000.571.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Request Participant* to the Create issue Screen on Service Desk Project
# Logged in as an agent, select Create issue

h3. Expected Results
Request Participant Field is present on Create issue Screen

h3. Actual Results
- *Request Participant* Field acts like a hidden field
- *Wheres My Field?* Helper indicates the field is present on the screen

h3.Workaround
- Set *Request Participant* to the edit issue Screen
- Create issue without a *Request Participant* 
- Edit issue and add in a *Request Participant* value

h3. Notes:
The same thing also happens for the *Organization* field.
fields.summary: Request Participant Missing from Create issue Screen
Allow for bulk modification of request type to issue type mapping
Display the priority of the ticket on the ticket list in the Customer Portal.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2424].
  {panel}

One of our customers contacted me with questions about Service Desk, starting with "how can I find it? is it gone?"
It was supposed to be findable in UPM, if not in marketplace.atlassian.com, but it is not.
I found it with google, but that's not what customers are expected to do, are they?

They also found documentation claiming that Service Desk requires the same user tier as base JIRA - I hope it only means they found the 1.0 documentation, not that this is what 3.0 is doing
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk unavailable for JIRA 6.x customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2423].
  {panel}

Currently it is possible to navigate from JIRA to the portal, but not from the portal back to JIRA. This suggestion is to add a way for a customer with a JIRA license to navigate from the portal to the JIRA interface.
* JIRA interface refers to JIRA Core, JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk when viewing the project through the JIRA project view.

h5. Example Use Case:
As a user of JIRA Software as well as JIRA Service Desk. I frequently find myself moving between these two applications. I would like an easy way to navigate between the customer portal and the JIRA interface.
* Currently there is no navigation from the portal back to JIRA. I find myself going to the URL and removing the Service Desk portion so that I am taken back to JIRA. 
* When working in JIRA Software, I must enter the URL for the Service Desk portal in order to access the portal and create a request. There is no navigation I can use to access the portal. (A workaround is provided below)

h5. Navigating from JIRA to Customer Portal
* The Service Desk menu at the top of the JIRA can be used to navigate to the portal (Service Desk > Create Service Desk Request)
* This menu was removed in JIRA 7. You can use [Application Navigator | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-346948276.html] to link to the customer portal URL. JIRA users can then use the application navigator to reach the Service Desk portal.
fields.summary: Provide easier way to navigate from customer portal to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2421].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA 7, it is no longer possible to see _Development Tools_ section for SD project type. Users need to either convert to Software project or create a new one as mentioned [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/cloud_jira+agile+jsd_post-update-checklist#Cloud_JIRA+Agile+JSD_Post-updatechecklist-4.Re-configureyoursoftwareandservicedeskprojects(ifneeded)].

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow development tools to be shown in SD project type if users have both application access (JIRA Software and JIRA SD).
fields.summary: Allow development tools to be shown in SD project type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2418].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk Request
# Make Agent1 to recieve issue commented notifications (make him a watcher, or smth that mathes your Notification Scheme)
# Collaborator or another Agent2 writes an internal comment -> Agent1 recieves notification (/)
# Now add Agent1 to "Request Participiants"
# Collaborator or another Agent2 writes an internal comment again -> Agent1 *does not* recieve notification (x)
fields.summary: Agent does not recieve internal comments notifications if he's mentioned in Request Participiants
